data.title: bd-1y1: Document label conventions for bead grooming
data.description: Added comprehensive Label Conventions section to packages/cli/docs/groom.md. Covers when to label, categories (epic/eval/docs/cli/review/etc), naming conventions (kebab-case), creating new labels, and examples of good vs over-labeling.

data.body: CRITICAL: Incorrect command syntax throughout the document. The command 'br label create <name>' does not exist. Labels are created implicitly when first used with 'br label add'. Additionally, 'br label add' uses the syntax 'br label add -l <label> <issue-id>', not 'br label add <bead-id> <label>' as shown in the doc.

CRITICAL: Line 76 states 'Check existing labels: br label list' which is correct, but line 79 says 'Create with br label create <name>' which is wrong. The 'br label create' command does not exist. Labels are created automatically when first used. The guidance should say: 'Apply with br label add -l <name> <bead-id> (creates label if it doesn't exist)'
